segment.source: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Client
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Client

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Client
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Client

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Client
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Client

segment.source: You can use the following procedures to upgrade the Application Virtualization (App-V) Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services).
segment.target: You can use the following procedures to upgrade the Application Virtualization (App-V) Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services).

segment.source: You upgrade the client by installing a new version over the previously installed older version.
segment.target: You upgrade the client by installing a new version over the previously installed older version.

segment.source: When you upgrade the clients, the installer software automatically preserves and migrates the user’s settings for virtual applications.
segment.target: When you upgrade the clients, the installer software automatically preserves and migrates the user’s settings for virtual applications.

segment.source: Administrative rights are required to run the setup program.
segment.target: Administrative rights are required to run the setup program.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: During the upgrade to Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 or later versions, the permissions to the HKCU registry key are changed.
segment.target: During the upgrade to Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 or later versions, the permissions to the HKCU registry key are changed.

segment.source: Because of this, users will lose user configurations that were set previously, such as user-configured Disconnected Mode settings.
segment.target: Because of this, users will lose user configurations that were set previously, such as user-configured Disconnected Mode settings.

segment.source: If the user is not actively restricted from configuring client user interface behavior through a permission lockdown, the user can reset these preferences after a publishing refresh.
segment.target: If the user is not actively restricted from configuring client user interface behavior through a permission lockdown, the user can reset these preferences after a publishing refresh.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: When upgrading to version 4.6 or a later version of the App-V Client, you must use the correct installer for the computer’s operating system, 32-bit or 64-bit.
segment.target: When upgrading to version 4.6 or a later version of the App-V Client, you must use the correct installer for the computer’s operating system, 32-bit or 64-bit.

segment.source: The installation will fail and an error message will be displayed if you use the wrong installer.
segment.target: The installation will fail and an error message will be displayed if you use the wrong installer.

segment.source: To upgrade the Application Virtualization Desktop Client
segment.target: To upgrade the Application Virtualization Desktop Client

segment.source: Shut down all virtual applications, right-click the App-V Desktop Client icon displayed in the Windows desktop notification area, and select Exit to shut down the existing client.
segment.target: Shut down all virtual applications, right-click the App-V Desktop Client icon displayed in the Windows desktop notification area, and select Exit to shut down the existing client.

segment.source: After you have obtained the correct installer archive file and saved it to your computer, double-click it to expand the archive.
segment.target: After you have obtained the correct installer archive file and saved it to your computer, double-click it to expand the archive.

segment.source: Browse to find the setup.exe file, and double-click setup.exe to start the installation.
segment.target: Browse to find the setup.exe file, and double-click setup.exe to start the installation.

segment.source: The wizard checks the system to ensure that all prerequisite software is installed and will prompt you to install any of the following, if missing:
segment.target: The wizard checks the system to ensure that all prerequisite software is installed and will prompt you to install any of the following, if missing:

segment.source: Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)
segment.target: Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)

segment.source: Microsoft Core XML Services (MSXML) 6.0 SP1 (x86)
segment.target: Microsoft Core XML Services (MSXML) 6.0 SP1 (x86)

segment.source: Microsoft Application Error Reporting
segment.target: Microsoft Application Error Reporting

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For version 4.6 and higher, the wizard will also install the following software prerequisite:
segment.target: For version 4.6 and higher, the wizard will also install the following software prerequisite:

segment.source: Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)
segment.target: Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)

segment.source: Click Install.
segment.target: Click Install.

segment.source: Installation progress is displayed, and the status changes from Pending to Installing.
segment.target: Installation progress is displayed, and the status changes from Pending to Installing.

segment.source: Installation status changes to Succeeded as each step is completed successfully.
segment.target: Installation status changes to Succeeded as each step is completed successfully.

segment.source: When the Application Virtualization Desktop Client dialog appears and displays a message stating that an older version of the client has been found on the computer, click Next to upgrade to the new version.
segment.target: When the Application Virtualization Desktop Client dialog appears and displays a message stating that an older version of the client has been found on the computer, click Next to upgrade to the new version.

segment.source: When the License Agreement screen is displayed, read the license agreement, and if you agree, click I accept the terms in the license agreement, and then click Next.
segment.target: When the License Agreement screen is displayed, read the license agreement, and if you agree, click I accept the terms in the license agreement, and then click Next.

segment.source: When the InstallShield Wizard displays the Ready to Upgrade the Program dialog screen, click Upgrade to begin the upgrade.
segment.target: When the InstallShield Wizard displays the Ready to Upgrade the Program dialog screen, click Upgrade to begin the upgrade.

segment.source: The next screen indicates that the client is being installed.
segment.target: The next screen indicates that the client is being installed.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: If you did not shut down the client program in step 1, you might see a Files In Use warning displayed.
segment.target: If you did not shut down the client program in step 1, you might see a Files In Use warning displayed.

segment.source: If this happens, right-click the App-V Client icon displayed in the desktop notification area and select Exit to shut down the existing client.
segment.target: If this happens, right-click the App-V Client icon displayed in the desktop notification area and select Exit to shut down the existing client.

segment.source: Then click Retry to continue.
segment.target: Then click Retry to continue.

segment.source: When the installation completes successfully, you will be prompted to restart the computer.
segment.target: When the installation completes successfully, you will be prompted to restart the computer.

segment.source: You need to restart the computer to complete the installation.
segment.target: You need to restart the computer to complete the installation.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: If the upgrade fails for any reason, you will need to restart the computer before attempting the upgrade again.
segment.target: If the upgrade fails for any reason, you will need to restart the computer before attempting the upgrade again.

segment.source: To upgrade the Application Virtualization Client by Using the Command Line
segment.target: To upgrade the Application Virtualization Client by Using the Command Line

segment.source: If upgrading the App-V client using the setup.msi program, ensure that any necessary prerequisite software has been installed.
segment.target: If upgrading the App-V client using the setup.msi program, ensure that any necessary prerequisite software has been installed.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For version 4.6 and later of the App-V client, the setup.msi program checks the system and will fail with an error message indicating that installation cannot continue if prerequisite software is not installed.
segment.target: For version 4.6 and later of the App-V client, the setup.msi program checks the system and will fail with an error message indicating that installation cannot continue if prerequisite software is not installed.

segment.source: For App-V version 4.6, command-line parameters cannot be used during an upgrade and will be ignored.
segment.target: For App-V version 4.6, command-line parameters cannot be used during an upgrade and will be ignored.

segment.source: The following command-line example uses the setup.msi file to upgrade the App-V Client.
segment.target: The following command-line example uses the setup.msi file to upgrade the App-V Client.

segment.source: You will need to use the correct client installer program depending on whether you are upgrading the App-V Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services).
segment.target: You will need to use the correct client installer program depending on whether you are upgrading the App-V Desktop Client or the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services).

segment.source: msiexec.exe /i "setup.msi"
segment.target: msiexec.exe /i "setup.msi"

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The quotation marks are required only when the value contains a space.
segment.target: The quotation marks are required only when the value contains a space.

segment.source: For consistency, all instances in the preceding example are shown as having quotation marks.
segment.target: For consistency, all instances in the preceding example are shown as having quotation marks.

segment.source: To upgrade the Application Virtualization Client for Remote Desktop Services
segment.target: To upgrade the Application Virtualization Client for Remote Desktop Services

segment.source: Follow your organization’s standard policies for installing or upgrading applications on the Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server.
segment.target: Follow your organization’s standard policies for installing or upgrading applications on the Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server.

segment.source: If the system is part of a farm, remove the RD Session Host from the server farm.
segment.target: If the system is part of a farm, remove the RD Session Host from the server farm.

segment.source: To upgrade the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), you must use the command line because you cannot upgrade the client manually on the RD Session Host.
segment.target: To upgrade the App-V Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), you must use the command line because you cannot upgrade the client manually on the RD Session Host.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In App-V version 4.6 and later, in addition to using the command line to upgrade the client, you can also use a Remote Desktop session.
segment.target: In App-V version 4.6 and later, in addition to using the command line to upgrade the client, you can also use a Remote Desktop session.

segment.source: No special parameters are required to start the Remote Desktop session.
segment.target: No special parameters are required to start the Remote Desktop session.

segment.source: After the Client for Remote Desktop Services upgrade is complete, restart and log in to the RD Session Host.
segment.target: After the Client for Remote Desktop Services upgrade is complete, restart and log in to the RD Session Host.

segment.source: After the system is restarted, add the server to the server farm.
segment.target: After the system is restarted, add the server to the server farm.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: If the upgrade fails for any reason, you will need to restart the computer before attempting the upgrade again.
segment.target: If the upgrade fails for any reason, you will need to restart the computer before attempting the upgrade again.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Application Virtualization Deployment and Upgrade Considerations
segment.target: Application Virtualization Deployment and Upgrade Considerations
